argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils module¶

Shared functions for ARGO packages

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.convert_conditions_to_argo_string(list_of_conditions: list, columns_int: list, columns_cat: list) → str[source]¶

Converts a list of conditions to the standard ARGO string format.

Parameters

  • list_of_conditions (list) – Each element contains a tuple of the feature (str), operator (str) and value (numeric) for each condition in the rule.

  • columns_int (list) – List of integer columns.

  • columns_cat (list) – List of OHE categorical columns.

Returns

The ARGO-readable rule name.

Return type

str

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.clean_dup_features_from_conditions(list_of_conditions: list) → list[source]¶

Removes unnecessary conditions from a rule (e.g. for a branch in a tree, the same feature and condition can be referenced, the threshold value is different. This method just takes the relevant threshold value).

Parameters

list_of_conditions (list) – Each element contains a tuple of the feature, operator and value for each condition in the rule.

Returns

Cleaned list of conditions

Return type

list

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.generate_empty_data_structures() → tuple[source]¶

Creates data structures often used in classes in ARGO.

Returns

Contains the rule_descriptions and X_rules dataframes

Return type

tuple

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.return_columns_types(X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Returns the integer, float and OHE categorical columns for a given dataset.

Parameters

X (pd.DataFrame) – Dataset.

Returns

list of integer columns, list of float columns, list of OHE

categorical columns

Return type

tuple

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.sort_rule_dfs_by_opt_metric(rule_descriptions: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, X_rules: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Method for sorting and reindexing rule_descriptions and X_rules by opt_metric

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.combine_rule_dfs(rule_descriptions_1: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, X_rules_1: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, rule_descriptions_2: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, X_rules_2: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → tuple[source]¶

Combines the rule_description and X_rules object of two rule sets

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.return_opt_func_perf(opt_func: object, y_preds: numpy.ndarray, y_true=None, sample_weight=None) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Calculates the given optimisation function across one or multiple binary predictors.

Parameters

  • opt_func (object) – A function/method which calculates a custom metric (e.g. Fbeta score) for each column.

  • y_preds (np.ndarray) – Set of binary integer predictors. Can also be a single predictor.

  • y_true (np.ndarray, optional) – Binary integer target column. Defaults to None.

  • sample_weight (np.ndarray, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

The optimisation metric for each record.

Return type

np.ndarray

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.return_binary_pred_perf_of_set_numpy(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_preds: numpy.ndarray, y_preds_columns: list, sample_weight=None, opt_func=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Calculates the performance of a set of binary predictors given a target column.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray) – Binary integer target column.

  • y_preds (np.ndarray) – Set of binary integer predictors. Can also be a single predictor.

  • y_preds_columns (list) – Column names for the y_preds array.

  • sample_weight (np.ndarray, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

  • opt_func (object, optional) – A function/method which calculates a custom metric (e.g. Fbeta score) for each column. Defaults to None.

Returns

Dataframe containing the performance metrics for each

binary predictor.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.return_rule_descriptions_from_X_rules(X_rules: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, X_rules_cols: list, y_true: None, sample_weight=None, opt_func=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Calculates the performance metrics for the standard rule_descriptions dataframe, given a set of rule binary columns

Parameters

  • X_rules (pd.DataFrame) – Set of rule binary columns.

  • X_rules_cols (list) – Columns associated with X_rules.

  • y_true (np.ndarray, optional) – Binary integer target column. Defaults to None.

  • sample_weight (np.ndarray, optional) – Row-wise sample_weights to apply. Defaults to None.

  • opt_func (object, optional) – A function/method which calculates a custom metric (e.g. Fbeta score) for each rule. Defaults to None.

Returns

The performance metrics for the standard

rule_descriptions dataframe.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.flatten_stringified_json_column(X_column: pandas.core.series.Series) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Flattens JSONs contained in a column to their own columns.

Parameters

X_column (pd.Series) – Contains the JSONs to be flattened.

Returns

Contains a column per key-value pair in the JSONs.

Return type

pd.DataFrame

argo.argo_utils.argo_utils.argo_utils.count_rule_conditions(rule_string: str) → int[source]¶

Counts the number of conditions in a rule string.

Parameters

rule_string (str) – The standard ARGO string representation of the rule.

Returns

Number of conditions in the rule.

Return type

int
